faq.question: What is Der Die Das Trainer?
faq.answer: Der Die Das Trainer is a free interactive web app to practice German articles (der, die, das). You get instant feedback, progress tracking, and 1000+ words from official Goethe A1/A2 vocabulary, plus support for your own word lists.

faq.question: How do I practice German articles?
faq.answer: Choose at least one dictionary in Settings (e.g. A1/A2 Goethe), then you'll see a noun and type or select the correct article (der, die, or das). You get immediate feedback and can track accuracy and streaks.

faq.question: Is Der Die Das Trainer free?
faq.answer: Yes. The app is free to use, with no account required. It runs in the browser and supports multiple training modes, progress tracking, and custom dictionaries.

faq.question: What vocabulary is included?
faq.answer: The app includes 1000+ words from official Goethe A1 and A2 vocabulary, and an optional B1 list. You can also add your own words or import custom dictionaries.

faq.question: Can I add my own words?
faq.answer: Yes. In Settings you can enable 'My Dictionary' and add or import your own nouns with optional translations. You can paste lists in the format 'der Hund — dog' and import them for practice.

faq.question: What languages does the trainer support?
faq.answer: The interface and translations are available in English, Russian, and Ukrainian. The word base is German with optional translations in these languages.
